item.description: Navena Chaitoo is a criminal justice researcher and policy expert with a career dedicated to improving outcomes for justice-involved individuals and strengthening oversight in New York Cityâ€™s jail system. She is the Assistant Executive Director of Research at the New York City Board of Correction (BOC), where she leads a team that conducts independent research on conditions of confinement, healthcare access, and compliance with correctional standards. Her work informs policy decisions, drives system improvements, and ensures accountability through data-driven oversight and evidence-based recommendations.

NYC Board of Correction Public Meeting (October 8, 2024) CUNY Graduate Center Dissertation Showcase (May 17, 2023) Pioneer of the Disability Rights Movement Speaks at Fordham: A Conversation with Judy Heumann (October 16, 2020) 20 in Their 20s: Navena Chaitoo (June 29, 2017) Rose Hill Student Wins National Science Foundation Graduate Research (May 13, 2013)
